isis.stitle: FE 300 BUS BODY COMPONENTS - INSTALL - Exterior Body Components

svcprocinfo.para: This section describes the procedures required to install the exterior body components that may have already been removed. All necessary warnings and safety precautions remain in effect during these installation procedures.

svcsubproc.title: Windshield Wiper Install
svcsubproc.para: Prior to installation of the windshield wiper assembly, check blades and washer fluid hoses for replacement.

step1.para: Locate the windshield wiper drive stud and key located to help set alignment of wiper arms.

calloutgroup.callout1: WINDSHIELD WIPER DRIVE STUD MOUNTING JAM NUT

step1.para: Place windshield wiper arm on drive stud aligning the key and key way.
Install the mounting nut and hand tighten.
Follow the same procedure for the opposite side if both wiper arms have been removed.
From the driver position, turn the ignition key, turn on the wiper switch on. Allow at least one full cycle of wiper operation.
Turn the wiper switch to the off position and allow the wipers to go to the park position.
Turn the ignition key off. Go outside the bus and check the location of the wipers in the parked position.

figure.caption: Figure 176. Windshield Wiper and Base Assembly

calloutgroup.callout1: WIPER ARM RETAINING NUT CAP COVER

step1.para: If the location is correct, tighten the wiper arm retaining nut to the proper torque value (See Torque chart).
Replace plastic cap on wiper arm assembly covering retainer nut.
Reconnect windshield washer fluid supply hoses at cowl and windshield wiper arm.

Operate the windshield wipers and washer to verify correct operation. If wipers contact each other or the window frames during operation, or if they look close and might contact each other or the windshield frame, adjust the wiper arm orientation as needed.

svcsubproc.title: Windshield Install
svcsubproc.para: Prior to windshield installation, the windshield glass should be inspected for cracks and or chips. The windshield fence structure and locator tabs should be inspected for any type of bends or damage that might create problems in seal mounting and or possible leaks. the windshield seal should also be checked for breaks, cracks or any other deformity that might cause windshield leaks or improper fit.

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury, or death, always wear safety glasses and gloves when handling glass.

para.emph: An assistant is required during the installation of the 4-piece windshield.

step1.para: Prior to installing the 4-piece windshield:

step2.para: Check the windshield mounting frame (fence) for any bends or distortion in the assembly. Straighten if necessary.

Check the windshield "H" seal for any cracks, breaks or deterioration. If found replace "H" seal. Check the windshield glass for cracks or chips in the glass or the edges. If the glass edge is chipped it should be ground smooth prior to installation.

When handling glass avoid contacting the glass with anything that might chip or crack the edges of the glass. Pressure on the glass will tend to concentrate at the chipped areas, causing cracks. If the glass is cracked, do not install. Replace with a new section.

step1.para: For large applications such as the windshield center section, install the mounting seal on the windshield frame around the opening.

step2.para: Align the seal on the insert tabs and lower windshield mounting frame.

calloutgroup.callout1: SOAPY SOLUTION OR WINDOW CLEANER SPRAY

step2.para: Spray a foam type window cleaner or soapy water solution on the windshield seal. This will lubricate the seal and help in the installation of the windshield glass.
With an assistant, locate the windshield glass panel section from the padded work stand and place in approximate position on the cowl assembly.

With the technician and an assistant on the opposite side of the bus windshield area, place the glass in the lower section of the windshield seal. Using a flat stock windshield tool work the glass into the lower seal section.
Align one side of the glass into the vertical seal section at the tee seal connector.
Using the flat stock tool ensure the glass is in the position in the vertical section. Use the same tool on the inside of the windshield to properly seat the glass in the vertical section.

With the assistant on the outside of the windshield glass, steady the assembly, insert a 1/8" rope section in the glass seal around the upper section of the main glass panel. Spray the glass again with a soapy solution to help insert the glass into the upper seal.
The assistant from the outside should apply a steady pressure against the upper portion of the center glass toward the windshield frame.

The technician using the glass tool should encapsulate the top corner of the windshield glass on the fence (or frame), then with a constant, steady pulling motion on the rope work across the top of the interior of the windshield glass. The technician should check that the glass is seating in the seal as he pulls the rope. If the step is done properly the windshield should be mounted in the seal on the windshield frame around the top and bottom and both ends of the center panel.

With the windshield glass properly seated in the top and bottom frame, use the flat stock tool and or other appropriate glass tool as may be available work the seal around the opposite end of the vertical windshield seal.
Check both the interior and exterior of the windshield panel for any irregularities in the seal that could cause a leaking condition.

calloutgroup.callout1: WINDSHIELD FLAT TOOL WORKING SEAL PERIMETER

item.para: Prior to installing side panel or wing glass, check the glass for cracks or chips.
Align seal with windshield frame at wing panel area.
Place the wing or side panel glass at the top corner of the seal and align the inboard edge in the vertical seal adjacent to the center windshield panel.
Spray the seal and glass with soapy solution to aid in installation of glass.
Using flat stock glass tool or other appropriate glass tool, work seal around the outside edge of the wing panel glass. Pressure should be applied against glass to fit glass into seal.
Continue around the exterior perimeter of panel or wing glass until entire panel is seated on window frame section.
Follow the same procedure on the inside of the wing panel ensuring the glass in inserted in the seal assembly.
Follow the same procedure for the opposite side wing panel (if necessary).

para.emph: The recommended windshield lace insertion tool : Lock Strip Straight Tool, Part number 201-1127 from Sommer Maca.

svcsubproc.para: A sufficient length of windshield lace should be on hand for installation. A single piece length is required to fit the entire perimeter of the windshield opening. Two additional sections for the vertical panels between the windshield and wing panels are required. Prior to installation find the center of the lace perimeter section and place at the approximate center of the windshield seal at the top of the windshield.

item.para: To install the lace rubber into the seal, use the lacing tool by threading the lace rubber into the tool. Depending on the method used and the direction in which the lace is installed will determine whether the tool is pushed or pulled while inserting the windshield lace.
After installation of the surround lace, install the two remaining vertical pieces between the panel glass sections and the center windshield panel.
A foam type glass cleaner or mild soapy solution and some water can be used to lubricate the rubber seal. This will ease installation of the lace rubber.
Inspect the installation and clean off the surface of the glass, both inside and outside the bus.
A pliable windshield seal may be used to seal the rubber and glass.

svcsubproc.title: Driver Side Rear View Mirror
svcsubproc.para: Check mirrors for cracks or any type of damage prior to installation. If the mirrors have a heater element option, check the wires and plug for breaks in the harness wire or cracks.

step1.para: Beginning on the driver side of the bus body, locate and align the mounting holes in the mirror and bus body.
Insert the four mounting bolts ( Figure 104, Item 2) and hand tighten.

If the mirror has the optional mirror heater, locate the harness wire and insert through the grommet in the body section. Connect the mirror harness plugs in the appropriate harness connections in the upper corner of the electrical compartment located under the drivers window on the exterior of the bus.
Tighten the mirror mounting bolts to the required torque value.
Enter the bus, open the driver sliding window and adjust the mirror to the proper settings.

svcsubproc.title: Passenger Side Rear View Mirror
svcsubproc.para: Prior to installing the passenger side rear view mirror ( Figure 13), check the mirrors for cracked mirror glass or any harness damage.

step1.para: Place a step ladder at the passenger side of the bus body by the passenger entry doors.
Locate the mounting holes for the mirror support brackets and hand tighten along the header above the top of the windshield assembly.
Align the mirror support bracket mounting holes with the header mounting holes, insert the bracket mounting bolts.
Locate the mirror base mounting holes on the "A" pillar forward of the side entry door. Align the mirror base with the mounting holes and insert the four mounting bolts. Hand tighten.
Attach the passenger side mirror support clip bracket to the mirror arm. Insert the attachment bolt, washer and lock nuts as required.
Adjust the mirror position and tighten all mounting bolts to the required torque.
If the mirror is equipped with optional heater element locate the mirror harness and insert into body harness hole. Install grommet on mirror harness, and insert grommet in opening.
Locate the mirror heater element harness and plug in the mirror connectors. Replace the "A" pillar cover.
Install the passenger side "A" pillar cover on the inside of the bus body. insert mounting screws in pillar cover, tighten. Install "A" pillar plastic cap covers over mounting screws.
Check mirror for adjustment, adjust as necessary.

svcsubproc.title: Front Warning Lights
svcsubproc.para: Replacement of the upper front warning lights on the face of the front end cap.

step1.para: Tilt the hood forward, using a step ladder to allow access to the end cap light locations, insert the warning light wire harness through the grommet.
Connect the warning light plug into the harness plug and insert in body opening.
Insert the grommet into bus end cap. Feed excess wire through grommet into the end cap.
Place warning light on end cap and align mounting holes.
Insert mounting screws and tighten.
Locate the warning light lens on the light assembly, insert the lens mounting screws and tighten.
Follow the same procedure for replacement of all other warning light assemblies on end caps.

svcsubproc.title: Destination Sign

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury, or death, always wear safety glasses and gloves when handling glass.

svcsubproc.para: The back lit destination board if previously removed because of damage to the glass area should be replaced only with I.C. Corporation authorized replacement parts, to ensure the proper fit and operation.

To ease installation, the rubber gasket can be heated with a non-flame source (heat gun). At high temperatures, the rubber gasket is more pliable. Do not heat above 125 degrees Fahrenheit for longer than one and a half hours.

Avoid contacting the glass with anything that may chip or crack the edges. Pressure on the glass will tend to concentrate at the chipped areas, causing cracks. If the glass is chipped, the edge should be ground smooth prior to installation.

step1.para: The glass destination sign is installed utilizing an "H" type glass seal. Locate the seal to be installed, check the seal for breaks or cracks.

For large installations such as the windshield glass, install the rubber gasket or seal onto the flange of the glass opening. For smaller applications, such as the entrance door, the rubber gasket should be located on the glass itself.
Install seal around perimeter of destination sign.
With the glass seated in the seal check the fit around the perimeter of the glass for distortion or cracks.
To install the lace rubber into the rubber gasket or seal, use the lacing tool by threading the lace rubber into the tool and installing the rubber.
Pull the lace rubber around the gasket, feeding the lace rubber into the tool using a hitching motion. This will help prevent the lace rubber form stretching.
A foam type class cleaner or a mild soap and some water can be used to lubricate the rubber gasket. This will ease installation of the glass lace rubber.
Inspect the installation and clean off the surface of the glass.
Seal the rubber gasket and glass with a pliable windshield type sealant.

svcsubproc.title: D.O.T. Lights and Reflectors
svcsubproc.para: The D.O.T. reflectors mounted on the exterior of the body as required by F.M.V.S.S. must be replaced if cracked or broken.

step1.para: To replace a damaged reflector, locate the mounting hole of the removed reflector ( Figure 107, Item 1).
Insert the mounting screw through the center hole of the reflector and mounting hole in the bus body. Tighten the mounting screw till snug.
Broken D.O.T. marker lights or lens must be replaced if broken or damaged.
Locate the lens mounting hole, insert the lens mounting screw, and align with the mounting hole on the marker light assembly.
Tighten the marker light lens mounting screw.
If the light assembly was broken, and removed, locate the marker light mounting hole on the bus body.
Locate the harness and plug in the new marker light connector. Insert the marker light wire through the body grommet and insert the grommet in the body panel.
Align the marker light mounting hole with body mounting holes. Insert the mounting screws and tighten. Replace the lens cover (see step 4).

svcsubproc.title: Vandal Lock
svcsubproc.para: The Vandal lock assembly is located at the front panel above the passenger side transition panel forward of the passenger entry door (if equipped).

step1.para: Prior to installing the vandal lock assembly through the bus body panel, install the jam nut and washer on the assembly stem. Allow extra length for mounting the exterior mounting nut and washers.
Install the vandal lock assembly from inside the bus body by sliding the assembly stem through the opening in the body panel.
Install the exterior lock washer and threaded collar.
From inside the bus slide the interior lock washer against the body panel. Tighten the jam nut against the washer and body panel.
Connect the vandal lock wiring leads to the harness connection ( Figure 109).
Check the assembly from outside the bus to ensure a snug tight fit.
Replace the dash panel.
Locate the mounting holes of the passenger entry dash panel.
Install the 8 mounting screws and tighten.
Install the screw cover caps.

svcsubproc.title: Passenger Entry Door
svcsubproc.para: Installation of the passenger entry doors may require the help of an assistant when aligning the pivot pins and blocks.

step1.para: With an assistant, place the forward door in the upright position at the door opening. Insert the upper pivot pin in the overhead header opening ( Figure 158).
Locate the lower pivot block and slide on lower pivot pin, align pivot block mounting holes with mounting holes in lower step door opening cross bar.
Insert the mounting bolts in the pivot block and support bar ( Figure 158, Item 2).
Check door in position and pivot points, ensure door swings freely.
Locate the door mounting bracket attached to the door opener drive arm. Align the bracket mounting holes with the mounting holes in the upper portion of door frame.
Insert two mounting bolts and tighten to required torque.
Follow the same procedure on opposite door if applicable.

svcsubproc.title: Fuel Fill Door
svcsubproc.para: The fuel fill door location varies depending on the location of the fuel tank assembly. All fuel doors have a positive closure spring, and may be equipped with a latching device or keyed lock. Locate the opening where the fuel fill door assembly is to be installed.

step1.para: Locate the fuel fill door assembly over the opening in the bus body side panel.
Align the mounting holes in the fuel fill door assembly with those in the bus body side panel.
Insert the six mounting screws in the fuel fill door assembly and tighten ( Figure 113, Item 1).

svcsubproc.title: Passenger Windows
svcsubproc.para: Passenger windows and related hardware are installed from the inside of the bus body. Reference Body Interior installation section.

svcsubproc.title: Emergency Exit Windows
svcsubproc.para: Emergency exit windows and related hardware are installed from the inside of the bus body. Reference Body Interior installation section.

svcsubproc.title: Emergency Exit Doors and Latches
svcsubproc.para: The rear emergency exit door is a flush mounted door assembly with interior recessed hinges.

step1.para: Prior to installing the door assembly, check the door seal for cracks and or breaks in the material. Replace if necessary.
With an assistant locate the emergency exit door in the bus body door opening.
Locate the hinge assemblies on the inside of the door assembly. Rotate the door hinge assemblies out and align with the hinge mounting plates on the inside of the door frame assembly.

Locate the mounting bolts in the hinge assembly ( Figure 116, Items 1 and 2 ) and hand tighten. Open the door and close to check for door fit in the opening. Adjust the door assembly as may be required. Tighten the hinge bolts, install the remaining hinge bolts, and torque to the required value.
Check the alignment with the door latch assembly and the buzzer plunger switch.
If the door is aligned and functional, install the plastic hinge covers on the interior hinge assemblies.
Locate the mounting holes in the plastic covers, and align with mounting holes in bus body.
Insert mounting screws and tighten.

svcsubproc.title: Roof Mounted Escape Hatch

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death always use a secured scaffold assembly and safety restraints when servicing the bus roof panels or roof component accessories. An assistant should be present during any roof or roof accessory repair procedures.

svcsubproc.para: Check the roof surface around the opening of the emergency roof hatch assembly. Make sure no sharp edges or foreign materials are present when installing sealer or the hatch assembly.

step1.para: Clean the roof area around the hatch opening prior to any installation procedure.

figure.caption: Figure 185. Emergency Roof Escape Hatch Opening

step1.para: Locate the roof hatch assembly on the opening and align the hatch mounting holes with the mounting holes in the roof section.
Apply sealer required to the roof or hatch assembly prior to fastening the hatch assembly in place.
Install the emergency escape hatch in the opening.
Align the mounting holes in the hatch perimeter frame and the mounting holes in the roof panel.
Using an industrial type rivet gun, insert the rivet in the mounting holes and secure the hatch assembly to the roof structure.
Install plastic fastener covers over fasteners on the hatch assembly.
Apply sealant around the outside perimeter of the hatch assembly at the roof line.
Connect hatch open alarm switch harness to bus harness connectors.
Install the interior trim ring in the ceiling, insert mounting screws and tighten.
Place plastic insert caps over the mounting screws.

svcsubproc.title: Wheelchair Access Door
svcsubproc.para: Prior to installing the wheelchair access door, check the door seals for cracks or breaks in the door seal and replace if necessary.

step1.para: With an assistant place the access door in the door opening. Check the alignment of the hinge mounting holes with the mounting holes in the bus body. Adjust the door as may be required.
Install the door hinge mounting bolts and hand tighten. Recheck the door alignment and seal for proper fit.

figure.caption: Figure 186. Wheelchair Lift Access Door Hinges

step1.para: If the door fits securely, tighten and torque door hinge mounting bolts to required torque values.
Check the door latch alignment; ensure proper latching and locking.
Check the alarm buzzer assembly plunger for proper alignment and operation.
Adjust as necessary.

svcsubproc.title: Rear Bumper Assembly
svcsubproc.para: An assistant is required for rear bumper installation.

step1.para: With an assistant locate the bumper to the rear of the bus body and align the rear mounting holes ( Figure 120, Item 2) on the bumper with those on the rear frame bumper mounting bracket.
Insert the upper mounting bolts through the bumper into the bumper mounting bracket. Install the bumper mounting bolt nuts and washers on the mounting bolts, hand tighten.
Locate and install the lower rear bumper mounting bolts through the bumper and mounting bracket.
Install the mounting nuts and washers on the bumper mounting bolts and hand tighten.
Locate and install ( Figure 120, Item 1) the remaining side bumper mounting bolts (2 each side) with nuts and washers. Hand tighten side bumper mounting bolts.
Check the alignment of the bumper assembly with the body. Locate and align the bumper transition panels at each end of the bumper assembly and side body panels.
Tighten all bumper mounting bolts and lock nuts to the required torque value.
Install the bumper transition panel mounting screws and tighten.

svcsubproc.title: Rear Body Exterior Lights and Warning Lights
svcsubproc.para: The rear body warning lights and standard stop, tail, directional and back-up lights all follow the same removal and install procedure.
A step ladder is required to access the warning light mounted on the end cap assembly.

step1.para: Locate the end cap light mounting locations, insert the warning harness wire and connector through the grommet.
Connect the warning light plug into the harness plug and insert in body opening.
Insert the grommet into bus end cap. Feed excess wire through grommet into the end cap.
Place warning light on end cap and align mounting holes.
Insert mounting screws and tighten.
Locate the warning light lens on the light assembly ( Figure 123, Items 1 and 2), insert the lens mounting screws and tighten.
Follow the same procedure for replacement of the stop, tail, back-up, and directional lights.

svcsubproc.title: Street Side Body Stop Signs
svcsubproc.para: Prior to mounting optional street side body stop signs, check the wiring harness connectors and the wiring access hole for proper grommet fit.

step1.para: Locate the wire harness connection and plug into the body harness. Feed the excess wire through the grommet.

Locate the stop sign mounting holes in the body side sheet. Align the stop sign assembly mounting holes with the body holes ( Figure 124, Items 1 and 2) and insert the mounting screws as required ( Figure 125, Item 3).
Tighten the mounting screws.

svcsubproc.title: Rubber Fenderettes
svcsubproc.para: With an assistant, locate the rubber fenderette at the rear wheel well opening;

step1.para: Locate the mounting holes in the fenderette, and align with the mounting holes in the wheel well opening trim ring ( Figure 126, Item 1).

Begin inserting the mounting bolts approximately every fourth bolt with washer and lock nut, hand tighten. There are 21 per side. With the pilot mounting bolts in place, install the remaining mounting bolts, washers and lock nuts.
Tighten all remaining nuts and recheck the fenderette alignment around the wheel well opening.
Torque all the lock nuts to the required torque value.

svcsubproc.title: Under Body Compartments
svcsubproc.para: The under body compartments can be installed without the door assemblies in place.

step1.para: With an assistant, locate the body compartment in the area of the compartment opening. Using a hydraulic lift or other mechanical means, raise the compartment assembly in place.
Locate the door frame assembly on the body side panel, align the mounting holes.
Insert the mounting screws through the door frame face plate assembly holes ( Figure 127, Item 2) and tighten.
Locate the luggage box hanger bracket, on the rear of the compartment assembly.
Install the "J" clip around the upper flange of the chassis frame rail. Locate the bracket mounting hole and the rear bracket hanger mounting hole.

Insert the mounting bolt, through the frame bracket and compartment hanger bracket. Install the washer and lock nuts as required. Tighten the underbody "J" clamp mounting bolts at the compartment mounting bracket.

caution.para: To avoid damage to vehicle electronic components, disconnect both battery positive (+) and (-) negative cables prior to any welding operations. Attach the welding ground cable as close as possible to the part being welded. If necessary to weld close to an electronic component, it is recommended that the component be temporarily removed.

step1.para: Check the surfaces on the flange edges of the compartment and the surface area of the floor structure where the compartment flange surface and the floor structure surface meet. Ensure that both surfaces are clean and free of dirt, undercoating or debris, prior to spot welding the compartment flanges in place.
When the compartment assembly has been welded in place, torque the "J" clip mounting bolts to the required torque value.
Clean all surfaces and undercoat or paint as necessary.
Seal all overlap joint seams with yellow sealer. Allow to dry before painting.

svcsubproc.title: Electrical Compartment Door
svcsubproc.para: Prior to installing the electrical compartment door assembly, check the door seal for breaks and/or cracks that might cause a leak problem into the chassis electrical compartment.

step1.para: Locate the door assembly hinge mounting holes and align them with the hinge mounting holes. The hinge assemblies are slotted for door adjustment.

calloutgroup.callout1: ELECTRICAL COMPARTMENT DOOR / HINGE MOUNTING NUTS

step1.para: Insert the hinge mounting bolts and nuts and tighten.
Close the electrical compartment door and check the seal and fit. If necessary loosen and adjust the mounting bolts and nuts in the hinge slots.

svcsubproc.title: Battery Compartment

caution.para: Excessive voltage or current applied to electronic components may damage or destroy them, resulting in expensive repairs.

To avoid damage to vehicle electronic components, disconnect both battery positive (+) and (-) negative cables prior to any welding operations. Attach the welding ground cable as close as possible to the part being welded. If necessary to weld close to an electronic component, it is recommended that the component be temporarily removed.

svcsubproc.para: The battery compartment face plate is mounted to the outside skin of the bus body panel and is mounted utilizing with Phillip head mounting screws along the front face perimeter.

step1.para: Prior to installing the battery compartment assembly, check the floor structure flanges for undercoating, paint, dirt and or debris. Clean surfaces where attachment points are to be welded in place.
Locate the battery compartment in the opening and support in place by jacks or other mechanical means.
Locate and align the mounting holes on the front face of the compartment assembly with the holes in the body side panel.
With the floor structure flanges clean and free of dirt and debris, spot weld the battery compartment mounting flanges to the floor structure flange assembly.
Install the battery tray and related hardware.

svcsubproc.title: Radio Antenna
svcsubproc.para: The entertainment radio antenna connection mounting is directly behind the driver side window (if equipped) ( Figure 36).

step1.para: Feed the antenna wire through the body opening with grommet on antenna wire. Insert grommet in body opening as required.
Locate the antenna mounting holes on the body, align the antenna mounting base and insert the mounting screws.
Tighten the mounting screws, and plug antenna end into radio.

svcsubproc.title: Driver Side Sliding Window
svcsubproc.para: The driver sliding window assembly is an aluminum extruded framed horizontal sliding dual panel window. The window individually slides forward and aft in the window frame. The window is secured with a positive latching device.
To install the driver sliding window;

step1.para: Prior to installation check the window frame and opening for old sealant, dirt and or debris. Clean as necessary.
Place the driver storm window assembly into the window frame opening.
Locate the frame mounting screws located in the bottom extrusion (4), on the forward vertical frame (2) and 3 across the top lip flange.
Insert the (4) mounting screws on the bottom of the window assembly extrusion. Tighten the mounting screws.
Locate the mounting holes in the forward vertical extrusion, insert the two mounting screws and tighten and tighten.
Install the mounting screws along the top extrusion of the window frame.
Double check the window for fit, apply seal around window frame area as may be needed.

svcsubproc.title: Driver Side Storm Window (Optional)
svcsubproc.para: The driver side storm window procedure follows the same procedure as listed above.

svcsubproc.title: End Caps
svcsubproc.para: The end caps on the front and rear of the bus body are replaceable. Care should be taken in the process or removal and installation of the assemblies.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death always use a secured scaffold assembly and safety restraint when servicing the bus roof panels or roof component accessories. An assistant should be present during any roof or roof accessory repair procedures.

note.para: When replacing end caps, some interior panels are required to be removed to drill pilot holes through the roof bows, for the end cap attachment process.

svcsubproc.para: When replacing the front cap assembly, the driver bulkhead compartment and any equipment mounted on it will have to be removed to access the roof bow assembly.
This includes:

item.para: First aid kits and body fluid clean-up kits.
Driver interior rear view mirror and sun visor (if applicable).
The forward ceiling panel or rear depending on end cap being replaced
Any other items that may be options that would be mounted on the driver overhead bulkhead.

step1.para: With the applicable interior items removed, mount the forward end cap on the roof assembly and header assembly.
Insert bolts in the lower forward edge and corners of the end cap assembly. Check the fit and alignment with the roof panels.
From the inside front section of the bus, drill through the roof bow and roof panel holes, through the end cap assembly.
With the roof bow holes drilled, prior to installing pilot rivets, install sealer adhesive along the existing roof panel and under the rear edge of the end cap.
Install pilot rivets across roof bow to ensure alignment.
Beginning at the front corner over the windshield install rivets through the new end cap mounting holes into header assembly and side section over driver window frame and entry door frame.
Insert the remainder of roof bow rivets as required, check joint seals at end cap and front roof panel.
If end cap seats properly, re-install interior bulkheads, and equipment that may have been removed.
Re-install the front windshield assembly (see windshield installation).
Install the end cap marker light and connect marker light harness plugs.
Seal all seams prior to paint.
If bus is equipped with glass destination board, Install the glass panel and seal as described in section.

svcsubproc.para: Follow the same basic procedure for rear end cap. Rear emergency door and windows need not be removed.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death always use a secured scaffold assembly and safety restraint when servicing the bus roof panels or roof component accessories. An assistant should be present during any roof or roof accessory repair procedures.

step1.para: Locate the static roof vent opening in the bus roof. Check the edges of the opening for old seal gasket material or sharp edges.
Locate the static roof vent and gasket assembly on the roof aligning the mounting holes in the roof vent and the roof ( Figure 137, Item 3).
Using an industrial type rivet gun, insert the rivets through the static roof vent flange into the roof panel assembly.
Seal as necessary, allow seal to dry before painting.

svcsubproc.title: Optional Roof Mounted Warning Lights
svcsubproc.para: Roof mounted clear strobe light assembly ( Figure 39).

step1.para: Prior to installing the roof mounted strobe light, ensure the surface is clear and clean of any dirt or debris.
Locate the strobe light harness connection plug and the body harness connection. Connect the plug assemblies, install the body grommet on the harness wire and insert in the body opening.
Locate the mounting gasket and place on body section. Align the mounting holes on the light base and insert fasteners.
Tighten fasteners and check gasket for proper seal.

svcsubproc.title: Body Attachments or Tie Downs
svcsubproc.para: The body attachment tie downs are mechanical fasteners that secure the body floor panels to the chassis frame rail. This application consists of a combination of body tie down clips.

caution.para: Failure to properly torque tie down bolts can result in body damage.

step1.para: Check for anti-squeak pad, if it is missing install. Locate the 1/2"-13 x 13 in "J"-clip and bolt around the chassis frame rail and insert in floor frame structure ( Figure 132, Items 1, 3 and 4).

step2.para: Install the washers and lock nuts.
Torque the "J"-clip bolt to 30-40 Lbf-ft. (41-54 Nm).

step1.para: Locate the shear bolt mounting angle at the upper section of the bumper mounting bracket assembly and chassis frame rail ( Figure 133, Item 3).

step2.para: Align the mounting holes in the shear angle assembly with the holes in the floor structure flange.
Insert the 1/2"- 13 x 43 1/2" mounting bolts, washers and lock nuts.
Torque the mounting bolts to 30-40 Lbf-ft. (41-54 Nm)

step1.para: Locate the formed tie down end in the notch in the floor flange structure. Locate the opposite end under the frame rail flange ( Figure 134, Items 4 and 5).

step2.para: Locate the 1/2'-13 x 2 1/2" bolt through the formed tie down and floor structure flange.
Install the washer and lock nut ad tighten to 30-40 Lbf-ft. (41-54 Nm).

step1.para: Locate the mounting hole in the driver platform frame assembly. Insert the 1/2"-13 x 4" mounting bolt through the compression spring and through the driver platform frame mounting hole ( Figure 135, Items 4 and 5).

step2.para: Install the flat washer and mounting nut. Torque to 30-40 Lbf-ft. (40.7-54 Nm).
